audienceSignals: Specific Industries such as AI, media, travel, insurance, and nonprofits

facts.text: Stripe provides a comprehensive financial infrastructure.
facts.evidence: Stripe provides a comprehensive financial infrastructure designed to facilitate online payments and manage business finances.

facts.text: Stripe supports over 100 payment methods worldwide.
facts.evidence: Supports online payments, in-person transactions, and access to over 100 payment methods worldwide.

facts.text: Stripe offers financial accounts and card issuance.
facts.evidence: Includes features like financial accounts, issuing physical and virtual cards, and global payouts.

facts.text: Stripe provides subscription management and invoicing tools.
facts.evidence: Offers subscription management, invoicing, tax automation, and revenue recognition tools.

facts.text: Stripe uses Stripe Radar for fraud detection.
facts.evidence: Utilizes Stripe Radar for fraud detection and prevention.

facts.text: Stripe provides custom reporting through Stripe Sigma.
facts.evidence: Provides Stripe Sigma for generating custom reports and data insights.

facts.text: Stripe is developer-friendly with extensive API documentation.
facts.evidence: Extensive API documentation and SDKs for easy integration into applications.
Tailored solutions for businesses of all sizes, from startups to large enterprises.
No-code payment solutions and prebuilt forms simplify the payment process for businesses.

facts.text: Stripe provides prebuilt forms for payment processing.
facts.evidence: No-code payment solutions and prebuilt forms simplify the payment process for businesses.
Customizable payment solutions that can be tailored to specific business needs.

facts.text: Stripe has robust fraud prevention measures.
facts.evidence: Robust fraud prevention measures and compliance with financial regulations.

facts.text: Stripe's infrastructure accommodates increasing transaction volumes.
facts.evidence: Infrastructure that grows with the business, accommodating increasing transaction volumes.

facts.text: Stripe's pricing model is based on transaction fees.
facts.evidence: Stripe typically operates on a transaction fee model, charging a percentage of each transaction processed through its platform.
